Class Message

java.lang.Object
Message
Direct Known Subclasses:
MultiMediaMessage, TextMessage
public abstract class Message
extends java.lang.Object
An abstract class working as a template for all messages - the idea is that for different versions of this app (e.g.: "mobile", "mobile-lite", "desktop") there might be different types for available options i.e. for "mobile-lite" it will be possible to use text messages only, and "mobile" will handle all the types. This class does not support "generic" setters, because once initialized a message can: -be deleted, -have receivers updated(added)

  • Constructor Details

    • Message

      protected Message​(java.lang.String emailSender, java.util.List<java.lang.String> emailReceivers, java.lang.String text)
      A simple constructor with no overloading
      Parameters:
      emailSender - email address of the author
      emailReceivers - email addresses of all the receivers
      text - content of the message

  • Method Details

    • deleteMessage

      public void deleteMessage​(User c)
      Allows to delete (make unreadable) message if the request is sent by its author or an admin
      Parameters:
      c - user requesting the deletion needs to pass her/his email to verify if she/he can do so

    • updateReceivers

      public void updateReceivers​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> newReceivers)
      Allows to update the list of receivers, avoiding the need to initialize a new message
      Parameters:
      newReceivers - stores a list of new receivers of the message

    • getDetails

      public java.lang.String getDetails()
      Combines metadata and content of a message to a single string
      Returns:
      Returns the combined string that describes all the data included in the message

    • getEmailSender

      public java.lang.String getEmailSender()

      returns email of the sender

    • getEmailReceivers

      public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getEmailReceivers()

      public java.util.Date getDate()

      returns date of message initialization

    • getDeleted

      public java.lang.Boolean getDeleted()
      Returns:
      returns true when message was deleted, false if was not
